alert.note: Alert for Oneida; Power (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 2:47PM MDT until August 13 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTH CENTRAL ONEIDA AND SOUTHEASTERN POWER COUNTIES... At 247 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. At 236 PM MDT, water was reported pouring into a residential basement in the Arbon area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, roads, and basements, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Arbon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report flooding or debris flows to the National Weather Service in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, when it is safe to do so.
